page.title: 07DIALECT/ RELIGION IN DUNS.
page.content:
THIS IS NOT AN AREA RICH IN DIALECT, PERHAPS BECAUSE OF THE LARGE NUMBER OF INCOMERS.PLACE NAMES REFLECT NO PARTICULAR INFLUENCE.DUNS ITSELF IS OF GAELIC ORIGIN BUT FEW OTHER NAMES ARE OF THE SAME ORIGIN.SOME,SUCH AS GRUELDYKES COME FROM OLD FRENCH BUT MOST ARE OF ENGLISH ORIGIN,SUCH AS LANGTON,MIDDLEFIELD ETC.
THERE ARE 4 CHURCHES IN DUNS,TWO CHURCH OF SCOTLAND,ONE ROMAN CATHOLIC AND ONE SCOTTISH EPISCOPAL. THE PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH IS THE LARGEST DENOMINATION, HAVING ROLLS OF 740 IN DUNS AND 190 IN GAVINTON. ST. MARGARET'S ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH HAS 170 AND THE EPISCOPALIANS NUMBER 150. ALL HAVE MEETINGS FOR CHILDREN AND LADIES IN ADDITION TO THEIR SUNDAY SERVICES.
